title: Collect usage statistics for various interfaces
body:
I thought we had an issue already on that, but I cannot find it.  I would be nice if opt'ed-in users could submit anonymously information on what API functionality was used/failed/etc.  Might relate to #2866 (add reporting those statistics as a part of the issue/etc submission)

Existing libraries/helpers:
- https://github.com/popylar/popylar  track software use with Google Analytics
- https://pypi.org/project/usagestats/ might be the closest to the desired implementation

Worthwhile discussions
- [Django](https://github.com/django/deps/pull/31) - quick summary (if I got it right) of GDPR becoming a show stopper for opt-out

Other projects approaches
- AFNI the program checks for new releases, so could be used
- PsychoPy has "call home" ping url thingie with basic information (OS, version etc) so they collect stats

Other ideas on how we could "trigger" the submission
- as a part of the bug report/contact community (TODO: reference the issue) 
- part of `duecredit` collection
- if provides some additional service as 
  - report new version(s) available
  - list which other software might be of interest

Collections methodologies (should be configurable per project although @yarikoptic likes cached one big one instead of many small ones):
- immediate upon invocation
- cached collection which would then get submitted only after some time has passed since last submission or on cron, etc

What to collect
- UUID  (zenodo???)
- name of the package/software
  - possibly with indication that it was triggered by some other package on top (e.g. fmriprep calling out to nipype and then freesurfer etc)
